register.description: The Revision Register contains the major and minor revisions for the module.

bitfield.description: Module ID field
RTL revision. Will vary depending on release.
Major revision
Minor revision

register.description: The performance control register contains fields which can be used to adjust the performance of the PKTDMA in the system.

bitfield.description: This feature is not currently supported

register.description: The emulation control register is used to control the behavior of the DMA when the emususp input is asserted.
The PSI-L proxy timeout register controls the timeout watchdog and reports timeout occurrances on PSI-L configuration transactions issued by the built in PSI-L proxy.

bitfield.description: Timeout occurred. When set indicates that a timeout has occurred on a config access
Timeout period. Specifies how many cycles to wait before closing up a conifiguration read or write transaction and asserting the tout bit

register.description: The Capabilities Register 0 specifies which standard features this PKTDMA instance supports.
The Capabilities Register 1 specifies which standard features this PKTDMA instance supports.
The Capabilities Register 2 specifies how many resources this PKTDMA instance supports.

bitfield.description: Rx internal channel count
Tx internal channel count

register.description: The Capabilities Register 3 specifies how many resources this PKTDMA instance supports.

bitfield.description: Tx ultra high capacity internal channel count
Tx high capacity internal channel count
Rx flow table entry count

register.description: The Capabilities Register 4 specifies how many resources this PKTDMA instance supports.

bitfield.description: Tx flow table entry count

register.description: This register enables or inhibits automatic clock gating to individual sub-blocks

register.description: This register provides a writable address which allows debug information to be read from the Debug Data Register

bitfield.description: Debug enable
Selects which unit to read debug information from
Selects offset within unit to access seperate debug registers

register.description: This register provides read only debug data

bitfield.description: Provides debug information from various internal units. The value which is read back depends on which unit and register are selected in the Debug Address Register

register.description: The Rx Flow FW Status Register 0 captures information about the thread/channel and received flow ID which failed a range check. Values in this register will remain persistent once an exception has been detected until the pend bit is written back to 0

bitfield.description: This bit is set whenever the Flow ID firewall detects a Flow ID is out of range for an incoming packet. Once this bit is set, the remaining fields in this register will not be modified. SW is required to write this bit to 0 to allow another exception to be captured.
This is the flow ID that was received on the trapped packet
This is the channel number on which the trapped packet was received
